intro: Didymochlamys connellii, commonly known as the Connell's didymochlamys, is a rare and unique member of the Malvaceae family. It is native to the mountainous regions of southern China, specifically the Yunnan Province. The plant is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It has a short growth period and is often found in rocky, well-drained soils. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
